comments:
When I start Eclipse 3.1M7 after I've used it to work on my Java project, during
the startup it reports that an error occured and when it starts in the editor
there are the files I've edited the last time but instead of the editor there is
a blank screen reporting that:
"Unable to create this part due to an internal error. Reason for the failure:
Editor could not be initialized."

I tried several times (even after eclipse.exe -clean) but it didn't help. Most
often there is a lot of error message dialogues (perhaps because I had about 6
java files that should be opened?). I also tried to disable all extensions I use
but it made no difference.

The exception:

Created an attachment (id=21702)
The full error log 

I exported it when I tried for the 2nd (or 3rd?) time and so it includes log
from 2 (or 3) sessions.

It seems you extracted Eclipse 3.1 M7 on top of an existing Eclipse install. Is
that correct? That is not supported. See the following doc on how to upgrade
Eclipse:

http://help.eclipse.org/help30/index.jsp?topic=/org.eclipse.platform.doc.user/tasks/tasks-2.htm

Yes, you're right! I've tried right now with Eclipse unpacked into an empty
directory and it works. Thank you very much! And I'm sorry I don't read the doc
carefully enough :-)
